                    <img/>Amazon Customer
                
            

            3.0 out of 5 stars
            
                Audio is great, but the implementation fails
            
            
            
                
                    
                        Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2022
                    
                    
                
            
        
        
            The good:The microphone is super well balanced and the capture distortion is minimal to non-existent.  Very happy with the concept.The bad:Nearby EMI interference kills all hope for a clean recording!  The cord is unshielded and the USB line makes a buzzing sound.  A USB signal isolator helps but not entirely, as the amplifier seems to not be ground shielded.  Unlike a Plantronics headset, which has this sort of isolator / EMI suppression built-in, this is a sad surprise.  This is sad as a Plantronics headset only operates up to 8-10khz in capturing audio.What I would want is a headset and microphone that wouldn't buzz every time I get near an LED of CFL lightbulb and would give a clear signal no matter the conditions!
        
        
            
                Images in this review

Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2020Verified Purchase I recently became an Internet radio broadcaster, and this was the headset mic that was recommended to me by several people who have been doing this for awhile. Music does sound good coming through the headphones, and they’re fairly comfortable. Mic does sound good...when it stays in one place. That’s my biggest problem. The arm that attaches the mic to the headset is deliberately flexible so the mic can be moved, but in this case, it’s actually too flexible, to the point where it doesn’t stay in the position I put it in. When I listen back to my voice breaks, I can hear their quality change because the mic moves position as I’m speaking. That’s extremely annoying! Read more 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Jay Dutch4.0 out of 5 stars Microphone A++ but Comfort D- Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2022Verified Purchase The audio quality of this mic is top notch. It's almost as good as my AudioTechnica which is 5x the price. Dynamic bass and crystal clear, very little background noise on my tests. With a USB -C adapter bought seperate it works great for podcasting from Android phone remote.However it's not comfortable. No give horizontally. Lacking a mute button is an oversight. If they fixed those two issues, this would be a 5 star.Still, highly recommended for an audio podcasting microphone. Estrada5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent for Podcasting Newbies Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2021Verified Purchase I just started a podcast and needed a new sturdy headset my kids wouldn't break. This set is perfect and well-priced. The sound quality is outstanding and the microphone is great. I don't know why, but it took me a while to figure out how to adjust the headset. (It just moves up and down, duh).My only complaint is that it doesn't come with adapters, which other mics do, so I have to find an adapter for my i-phone and stand-alone mic. But overall, I'm quite satisfied with the product. Read more Helpful Report abuse HonestFeedback5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite stereo headphone with microphone that I've owned Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2017Verified Purchase This USB stereo set is truly excellent. I'm currently using them to write this review using Dragon NaturallySpeaking and even though I lost my voice a couple of days ago the transcription accuracy so far as 100% (Woops 'is' was translated 'as' user corrected).The headphones are very comfortable and the microphone is flexible and adjustable so that it can pick up my voice easily. Some headsets don't have flexible microphones and they are kind of hard and they just stick out, which doesn't make for good sound quality pickup from the microphone piece.This is actually my favorite headset that I've owned out of the three or four different headsets that I've owned. I haven't had any complaints that people can't hear me when I use Google phone to call people and I used to get some complaints here and there. I've also noticed a significant increase in transcription accuracy since using this microphone/headset. Read more 5 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Bstephens4.0 out of 5 stars Pain on the ears but best mic for the $ period Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2012Verified Purchase I use headsets for typing with Dragon NaturallySpeaking and always have problems with recognition. I had assumed it was the software as I have gone through numerous headsets over the years and despite always ending up with a different brand or model the recognition works about the same. When my last set broke I was determined to focus on finding a quality mic. However, I found it near impossible to find any reviews that dealt with mic's or the use of a particular headset for dictation. I finally picked these because of one blog review that listed them as their top choice for dictation.My initial impression - they look kinda cheep and the ear pads are very small and perfectly horizontal with no pivot or give (not angled like the natural angle of ears on a face) so they put uneven pressure and sit painfully on top of the ear (not around), making it hard to wear for more than a few minutes. Deal-breaker, or so I thought.On using them once with Dragon, I changed my mind. I have since put in the time to modify the cups to fit around my ears and they are way better.The point is, this mic works perfectly, Dragon almost never misses a beat and while the design and comfort are the pits, the product works better than anything else I have tried including much more expensive sets. Estrada5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent for Podcasting Newbies Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2021Verified Purchase I just started a podcast and needed a new sturdy headset my kids wouldn't break. (It just moves up and down, duh).My only complaint is that it doesn't come with adapters, which other mics do, so I have to find an adapter for my i-phone and stand-alone mic. Read more Helpful Report abuse HonestFeedback5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite stereo headphone with microphone that I've owned Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2017Verified Purchase This USB stereo set is truly excellent. I'm currently using them to write this review using Dragon NaturallySpeaking and even though I lost my voice a couple of days ago the transcription accuracy so far as 100% (Woops 'is' was translated 'as' user corrected).The headphones are very comfortable and the microphone is flexible and adjustable so that it can pick up my voice easily. Some headsets don't have flexible microphones and they are kind of hard and they just stick out, which doesn't make for good sound quality pickup from the microphone piece.This is actually my favorite headset that I've owned out of the three or four different headsets that I've owned. I haven't had any complaints that people can't hear me when I use Google phone to call people and I used to get some complaints here and there. I've also noticed a significant increase in transcription accuracy since using this microphone/headset. Read more 5 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Bstephens4.0 out of 5 stars Pain on the ears but best mic for the $ period Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2012Verified Purchase I use headsets for typing with Dragon NaturallySpeaking and always have problems with recognition. I had assumed it was the software as I have gone through numerous headsets over the years and despite always ending up with a different brand or model the recognition works about the same. When my last set broke I was determined to focus on finding a quality mic. However, I found it near impossible to find any reviews that dealt with mic's or the use of a particular headset for dictation. I finally picked these because of one blog review that listed them as their top choice for dictation.My initial impression - they look kinda cheep and the ear pads are very small and perfectly horizontal with no pivot or give (not angled like the natural angle of ears on a face) so they put uneven pressure and sit painfully on top of the ear (not around), making it hard to wear for more than a few minutes. Deal-breaker, or so I thought.On using them once with Dragon, I changed my mind. I have since put in the time to modify the cups to fit around my ears and they are way better.The point is, this mic works perfectly, Dragon almost never misses a beat and while the design and comfort are the pits, the product works better than anything else I have tried including much more expensive sets. Strawberry3.0 out of 5 stars Audio is great, but the implementation fails Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2022Verified Purchase The good:The microphone is super well balanced and the capture distortion is minimal to non-existent. Very happy with the concept.The bad:Nearby EMI interference kills all hope for a clean recording! The cord is unshielded and the USB line makes a buzzing sound. A USB signal isolator helps but not entirely, as the amplifier seems to not be ground shielded. Unlike a Plantronics headset, which has this sort of isolator / EMI suppression built-in, this is a sad surprise. This is sad as a Plantronics headset only operates up to 8-10khz in capturing audio.What I would want is a headset and microphone that wouldn't buzz every time I get near an LED of CFL lightbulb and would give a clear signal no matter the conditions! Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2020Verified Purchase I recently became an Internet radio broadcaster, and this was the headset mic that was recommended to me by several people who have been doing this for awhile. Music does sound good coming through the headphones, and they’re fairly comfortable. Mic does sound good...when it stays in one place. That’s my biggest problem. The arm that attaches the mic to the headset is deliberately flexible so the mic can be moved, but in this case, it’s actually too flexible, to the point where it doesn’t stay in the position I put it in. When I listen back to my voice breaks, I can hear their quality change because the mic moves position as I’m speaking. That’s extremely annoying! data.text: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2022

The audio quality of this mic is top notch. It's almost as good as my AudioTechnica which is 5x the price. Dynamic bass and crystal clear, very little background noise on my tests. With a USB -C adapter bought seperate it works great for podcasting from Android phone remote.However it's not comfortable. No give horizontally. Lacking a mute button is an oversight. If they fixed those two issues, this would be a 5 star.Still, highly recommended for an audio podcasting microphone.

HonestFeedback5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite stereo headphone with microphone that I've owned Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2017Verified Purchase This USB stereo set is truly excellent. I'm currently using them to write this review using Dragon NaturallySpeaking and even though I lost my voice a couple of days ago the transcription accuracy so far as 100% (Woops 'is' was translated 'as' user corrected).The headphones are very comfortable and the microphone is flexible and adjustable so that it can pick up my voice easily. Some headsets don't have flexible microphones and they are kind of hard and they just stick out, which doesn't make for good sound quality pickup from the microphone piece.This is actually my favorite headset that I've owned out of the three or four different headsets that I've owned. I haven't had any complaints that people can't hear me when I use Google phone to call people and I used to get some complaints here and there. I've also noticed a significant increase in transcription accuracy since using this microphone/headset. Read more 5 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse

Bstephens4.0 out of 5 stars Pain on the ears but best mic for the $ period Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2012Verified Purchase I use headsets for typing with Dragon NaturallySpeaking and always have problems with recognition. I had assumed it was the software as I have gone through numerous headsets over the years and despite always ending up with a different brand or model the recognition works about the same. When my last set broke I was determined to focus on finding a quality mic. However, I found it near impossible to find any reviews that dealt with mic's or the use of a particular headset for dictation. I finally picked these because of one blog review that listed them as their top choice for dictation.My initial impression - they look kinda cheep and the ear pads are very small and perfectly horizontal with no pivot or give (not angled like the natural angle of ears on a face) so they put uneven pressure and sit painfully on top of the ear (not around), making it hard to wear for more than a few minutes. Deal-breaker, or so I thought.On using them once with Dragon, I changed my mind. I have since put in the time to modify the cups to fit around my ears and they are way better.The point is, this mic works perfectly, Dragon almost never misses a beat and while the design and comfort are the pits, the product works better than anything else I have tried including much more expensive sets. Read more 20 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse

I use headsets for typing with Dragon NaturallySpeaking and always have problems with recognition. I had assumed it was the software as I have gone through numerous headsets over the years and despite always ending up with a different brand or model the recognition works about the same.  When my last set broke I was determined to focus on finding a quality mic.  However, I found it near impossible to find any reviews that dealt with mic's or the use of a particular headset for dictation.  I finally picked these because of one blog review that listed them as their top choice for dictation.My initial impression - they look kinda cheep and the ear pads are very small and perfectly horizontal with no pivot or give (not angled like the natural angle of ears on a face) so they put uneven pressure and sit painfully on top of the ear (not around), making it hard to wear for more than a few minutes. Deal-breaker, or so I thought.On using them once with Dragon, I changed my mind.  I have since put in the time to modify the cups to fit around my ears and they are way better.The point is, this mic works perfectly, Dragon almost never misses a beat and while the design and comfort are the pits, the product works better than anything else I have tried including much more expensive sets.

I have since put in the time to modify the cups to fit around my ears and they are way better.The point is, this mic works perfectly, Dragon almost never misses a beat and while the design and comfort are the pits, the product works better than anything else I have tried including much more expensive sets.
